content:
Hi! 
There's a problem you can have 100% in IDE and only 75% in validation
That's an issue when a puzzle is intended for Clash of Code

It should state that digits will be in the test cases and that they should be omitted along with any characters that are not letters in the goal, but I appreciate the fact that you added it in constraints, a lot of people miss that part

Maybe this would be a clearer statement:

The given [[message]] will be encoded with the given [[key]] by encoding the letters in the [[message]] by adding to them the current value (a=0,b=1,c=2...z=25) from the [[key]].  Use the [[key]] as many times as needed to encode the whole message.  (Note: wrap from 'z' back to 'a' during the encoding process)

The statement is still not clear.

"The whole message contains only lowercase letters and spaces" is not true.  The bank one has the number 9 in it.  The statement should should say only encode letters if you are going to leave numbers in it. And remove that statement from the constraints.

The statement never says wrap around from z back to a (might be assumed, but wouldn't hurt to spell it out)

The puzzle is good, but the description is impenetrable.  The worked example takes a while to unpack because it tends to melt into a wall of numbers and pluses.  Maybe the characters of [[message]] don't need to be converted numerically there; people can get informally that s+2 is u.  Also, careful use of monospace and alignment can help to get across the idea in broad strokes.  All the necessary information is there in an example, but it looks like soup.

Finally, I would find it helpful if the example in the description used a message with spaces in it, say "i am one" instead of "someone".  It doesn't cost anything, and when the example continues to disregard whitespace, it'd be a very economical way to convey the correct handling.

Some of the sentences can just be deleted.  This draft has "Each character is encrypted independently of other characters."  I find this unnecessary and misleading.  Surely if you were to delete one character of the plaintext, the correspondence between the rest of the message and the key would be affected!

It's a good Clash; just let it shine more.

Hey CodinGamer! Your contribution has unfortunately not been moderated on time and will temporarily be removed from the system... But no worries! You can republish it anytime to give it another chance! :)

I think, if you want to get this approved, you should probably rewrite the entire writeup. It's a complete mess, you contradict yourself multiple times. I'm happy with the coding part (if you make the number situation consistent in your writeup). When rewriting your text you should really think about, what excactly you want to say.
Hi CatapultMS, I submitted for decoding, but now i am submitting the same problem but for encoding. For doing the inverse of what i submitted before. Is that ok? Thanks for your comment.
Arcene, didn't you already submit a Vigenere cipher clash before?
Thanks you very much M1lk4fr3553r, I haven t specified about the numbers because all the messages contain only alphabets. thanks a lot for the mistakes you have fixed and for your assistance...

1. The first Test-Case should be your Example
2. You are stating, that whitespace is ignored, however you dont state, that you don't have to skip that character in the key.
3. There is no indication, that numbers are handled like whitespace.

I've fixed some spelling mistakes.
You've got numbers in your "bank" test-case.
Thanks  M1lk4fr3553r, would you please tell me where i have contradicted myself? Please assist me. Thanks...
Thanks a lot for your professional comment and correction. i m going to remove unnecessary lines and change the example. thank you dear Zapakh!
Thanks Dear Rockit
Understood, I am going to modify it.
Thanks a lot Dear Gortax... Much appreciated!
hello my dear, let me check please... i am gonna fix it. thanks for your comment
You did not fix this. I have updated the test case.
It is fixed Qualia, let me recheck it once more again. Thanks for your comment and contribution

Thanks a lot for the genuine and brilliant observation
M1lk4fr3553r, I have seen and specified in the constraints that white spaces are ignored and numbers should be treated as white spaces, and the key should be moved to match the next corresponding character. Thanks again!
